result.execSummary:
David Alvarado was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means David Alvarado was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Alvarado

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  John E. Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for.  Defendant has been turned over to the State of COLORADO (D.O.C.) on April 5, 2022
On motion of the state, Court ordered case closed.

Defendant David Alvarado in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant David Alvarado in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Alvarado appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Colorado.  Defendant waived extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
